page.title: 15TRANSPORT
page.content: RAILWAY A railway line runs through the area but there is no station. The nearest stations are at Diss (7 miles) and Stowmarket (9 miles). Trains go to Norwich or London. BUSES A bus goes to Eye and Diss every morning except Sunday, and to Stowmarket on Wednesdays and Saturdays and on school days during term time. Buses also go twice a week to Bury St. Edmunds. These services are better suited to shoppers than workers. POST BUS A daily Post Bus transported passengers to and from Diss while delivering mail. This service lasted 10 years, touching several villages, but was withdrawn in June 1985 due to lack of support.
